snippet: A member of Al Qaeda said the attack on the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bamako was carried out by a jihadist group loyal to Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a Qaeda operative.
abstract: Al Qaeda member confirms that attack on Radison Blu Hotel in Mali, killing 19, was carried out by Jihadist group loyal to Algerian operative  Mokhtar Belmokhtar; analysts view terror attacks by Al Qaeda as attempt to assert group's position against rising Islamic State in quest to gain supremacy among jihadists on global scale.

byline.original: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and NABIH BULOS
byline.contributor: Liam Stack and Amy Chozick contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A member of Al Qaeda said the attack on the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bamako was carried out by a jihadist group loyal to Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a Qaeda operative.

headline.main: Mali Hotel Attackers Are Tied to an Algerian Qaeda Leader
headline.print_headline: Attackers at Hotel Are Linked to an Algerian Qaeda Leader
